entry.title: [Android] Do not consider "long" clicks as drags in AppMenu
entry.content:
Consider drags only after some MotionEvent of type MOVE is received.



This avoids reloading the page (reload is the button that appears right

over the app menu button) with a slightly long click. When using a

finger to tap, you can't even see the reload button, so I doubt this is

ever a desired outcome.



Also, actually open the app menu in Public Transit tests which was

blocked on this issue because Espresso sends clicks that are too long

with click() to fall under the 550ms mTapTimeout.

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Use microsecond resolution for ElapsedTime scoring metric.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the Omnibox.URLScoringModelExecuted.ElapsedTime metric

was being logged with millisecond resolution. While this is fine in

general, the issue is that the ML scoring model would often take a

fraction of a millisecond (e.g. 0.3 ms) for a single suggestion scoring

pass. As such, most of the logged times would get clustered into a

single bucket when viewing the data via chrome://histograms.



In order to remedy this issue, this CL updates the histogram definition

and logging code to use a more fine-grained microsecond resolution for

emitted samples. As a result, the data in chrome://histograms associated

with this metric is much more readable (i.e. not as tightly clustered),

which should help simplify analysis when looking at these numbers during

future experimentation.



BEFORE: http://screen/4GATHgj6PZqGXaf

AFTER: http://screen/9WyN8epUy2tMhSE

entry.title: Call SetLastActive with BrowserView::Activate.
entry.content:
On platforms other than Windows or Ash, calling

`BrowserWindow::Activate()` does not call

`BrowserList::SetLastActive()` synchronously but waits for

`OnWidgetActivationChanged()` to call it (which gets called

async).



However if its called from `BrowserView::Show()`,

`BrowserList::SetLastActive()` gets called synchronously as commented

in the function. Because of this by the time `ProcessSessionWindows()`

finished running, `BrowserList::SetLastActive()` is called in order

the browser appears in the order of the `windows` passed to

`ProcessSessionWindows()` but not get called for `browser_to_activate`

which is supposed to ensure that the correct browser is restored

as the active browser.



To fix this issue, call SetLastActive from `BrowserView::Activate`

the same way `BrowserView::Show()` does.



Otherwise when profile is activated by

`ProfileLaunchObserver::ActivateProfile`, incorrect browser gets

activated.



Some information can be found on

https://docs.google.com/document/d/13nOG8hftYBebJJ422g_Rl-S8WF59jMaKiIdYj4_3MXo/edit?resourcekey=0-Ylakdx356ti4k9AmG8RbzA&tab=t.0

entry.title: [anchor] Avoid Length in OutOfFlowLayoutPart::ApplyInsetArea
entry.content:
What we really care about in this function is the result of various

anchor() functions. A future CL will remove anchor() from Length,

which will make evaluating anchor() via Length impossible.

We can evaluate using the AnchorEvaluator directly instead.



Also fixes an issue with InsetAreaUsedInsetsTest where we could

get calls to InsetArea::AnchorTop (etc) before

CoreInitializer::Initialize.



There should be no behavior change.



Note: For now we're still using CalculationExpressionNode as the input

for anchor() evaluation, but we'll use something unrelated to Length's

calc() tree in the future.

entry.title: Fix getComputedStyle parsing with pseudo-element+argument to match spec
entry.content:
- Use normal selector parser instead of custom parser function

- Return 0 for .length when parser is not found.



This fixes a bunch of edge cases, like

getComputedStyle(element, "::highlight(. name)").



This CL works in the following way:

- for old pseudos (before, after, first-letter, first-line), we

allow the legacy behavior of single-colon / no-colon.

- otherwise, we use the standard pseudo-selector parser

- An unmatched pseudo-element (in getComputedStyle) would return a

length of 0, and would not inherit any style (even for placeholder).

- UA-shadow pseudos (::placeholder, ::file-selector-button) maintain

their current behavior, where getComputedStyle returns the element's

style.

- Using this in WAAPI will be done in a followup, for now this is only

for getComputedStyle.

entry.title: [media] VTVD: Handle show_existing_frame outputs
entry.content:
When AV1Decoder encounters a show_existing_frame unit, it calls

OutputPicture() without ever providing the bitstream to SubmitDecode().



This CL adds SetStream() to AV1Accelerator API so that VTVD always has

access to the bitstream.



VTVD now creates the block buffer in SetStream(), the format description

in SubmitDecode(), and combines them together into a sample in

OutputPicture().

entry.title: [ocr-a11y]: introduce paragraphs derived from OCR blocks
entry.content:
Currently, OCR protos -> a11y node data does not capture paragraph information.



OCR surfaces a block id from which we can infer paragraph.s



Note that this data does not appear to quite equate to paragraphs as one

would expect but to some unit between a line and a paragraph. Thus,

further work should be done to compute a larger block as a paragraph

e.g. utilizing the same heuristics as PdfAccessibilityTree.



It is still worthwhile to introduce this change which makes text have

some separation.



Example

https://health.mo.gov/lab/pdf/PublicWaterMassMailing.pdf



line: SOURI DPARTMEN

line: DHSS



is a "paragraph" (belonging to the same block id) though we may want

more text included.



R=kyjungjunlee@google.com, rhalavati@chromium.org

entry.title: [Android TRM] Update tile recency and domain texts.
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes to tile texts to better match TRM

on iOS:

* Recency text:

* "just now" --> "1 min ago"

* "minute[s]" --> "min".

* "hour[s]" --> "hr".

* Keep "day[s]" same as before.

* For single tile view, bottom text:

* Reorder "recency \u2022 domain" --> "domain \u2022 recency".

* Move ellipsis from end to middle.

* Simplify domain, e.g., “issues.chromium.org” --> “chromium.org”.



Note: Double tile view specifies "recency \u2022 domain". This matches

the mock, and there's no need to change.



Details:

* Add new strings for abbreviated time units:

* IDS_N_MINUTES_AGO_NARROW: "# min ago".

* IDS_N_HOURS_AGO_NARROW: "# hr ago".

* Skipping .png.sha1 files, like sibling IDS_N_*_AGO strings.

* Update TRM info strings:

* IDS_TAB_RESUMPTION_MODULE_SINGLE_POST_INFO: Flip recency & domain.

* IDS_TAB_RESUMPTION_MODULE_MULTI_INFO: Example fix.

* Update 4 .png.sha1 files to match new texts.

* @id/tile_post_info_text: Add android:ellipsize="middle".

* TabResumptionModuleUtils:

* Update getRecencyString() for new recency text.

* Add getDomainUrl() to use UrlUtilities.getDomainAndRegistry(),

just like crrev.com/c/5318313.

* Add toggleIsAvoidingJniForTesting() to assign |sIsAvoidingJni|.

* Update tests:

UrlUtilities.getDomainAndRegistry() error in tests.

entry.title: Use the origin to commit in GetFrameHostForNavigation's CADFO check.
entry.content:
Currently, GetFrameHostForNavigation has a CanAccessDataForOrigin

check at the end to verify that the process that was picked for

navigation is actually suitable for the target URL. However, that

check just directly creates a url::Origin from the target URL, without

accounting for cases that may make that origin opaque, such as

sandboxed frames. This makes it complicated for CanAccessDataForOrigin

to tell whether the access check should pass when it's made for

a sandboxed frame process, since the expectation is that such processes

should only deal with opaque origins.



This CL changes this check to use the origin to commit that's computed

in the browser process. This is a prerequisite for subsequent CLs

that will restrict access from sandboxed frame processes.

entry.title: De-alias DeferredTaskHanler::GraphAutoLocker
entry.content:
This CL should cause no functional change.



BaseAutoContext::GraphAutoLocker is an alias to

DeferredTaskHandler::GraphAutoLocker. This is confusing, since it

looks like there are more locks than there actually are. Remove the

alias and use the DeferredTaskHandler version directly from now on.



Also do the same for OfflineGraphAutoLocker.



Note that both of these lockers are actually locking the related

DeferredTaskHandler for the context, so this change should also be

more clear what is actually being locked.

entry.title: Compute APK referrer chains at download start
entry.content:
Referrer chain computation is based on the WebContents and

RenderFrameHost associated with the DownloadItem. These are cleared

when the page navigates [0], which could lead to a significant loss of

referrer chain telemetry.



Instead, this CL follows the pattern used by the

DownloadProtectionService, and computes the referrer chain at download

start, when the WebContents is still very likely to exist.



[0] - https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/download/download_item_utils.cc;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;l=80

entry.title: [autofill][flag] Add AutofillEnableSaveCardLocalSaveFallback to flags
entry.content:
Add the AutofillEnableSaveCardLocalSaveFallback feature flag to

chrome://flags. When enabled, if the server card fails to be uploaded,

the card will be saved locally as a fallback. If a card with the same

card number and expiration date already exists in the local database,

it will result in a no-op and the existing card will not be updated.

entry.title: Prevent USB devices with CDC interfaces from creating a 'share' notification.
entry.content:
Since enabling go/lofn, devices such as ethernet adapters have begun

produding a 'share with linux' etc notification. It is highly doubtful

most users will want to share such a device with a guest, so we add CDC

as a filtered class for creating a notification. Of note, some USB docks

or monitors produce such a notification which is annoying to end users.



NOTE: this *does not* prevent users from sharing a device if they really

wish to, it simply prevents a notification from being created.

entry.title: [iOS] Change DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECKs to DCHECKs in password-related classes
entry.content:
As part of the investigations on the child coordinator issue (see linked

bug), DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECKs were used to get crash reports from the Stable

channel. Now that the issue has been investigated a bunch and that we've

decided not to make any structural changes in relation to it, this CL

switches the DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECKs back to DCHECKs in password classes.

Even though we now know that a coordinator's child coordinator may not

always be null before being started due to possible race conditions, we

think using DCHECKs is still useful for debugging purposes.



Bug: 40067451

entry.title: [AssistData] Add stubbed methods for Java-side tree population
entry.content:
This CL stubs out the C++-side process for populating a Java-side tree

for the AssistData feature. All methods are currently stubbed and have

no implementation. This CL adds the recursive methods needed to

traverse a full C++-side tree and create the Java-side objects. In

future CLs we will add the implementation details for each of the

stubbed populate methods in this CL.

entry.title: Rename a method in anticipation to its replacement
entry.content:
A new MoveWebStateWrapperAt is going to do more than what the current

implementation is doing. Currently it does move the wrapper and update

the active index. The new version will also update the pinned count,

update the group of the wrapper, the groups ranges, and notify the

observers.



Since new clients will only be moved one by one, it is needed to keep

this previous version around until all moved, at which point it will be

removed.



Bug: 325435946

entry.title: MiraclePtr: Separate Android field trial config
entry.content:
We're experimenting with fine-tuning BRP params across all platforms.



* The `all-processes` selector applies to all platforms (n.b. we're

hoping to launch it soon for desktop).



* The `same-slot` parameter applies to non-Android platforms [1][2].



To satisfy internal checks, this CL splits the field trial config for

BRP enablement across Android/non-Android lines s.t. Android is only

touting `all-processes` (and not `same-slot` mode).



[1] https://crbug.com/41483807

[2] Internal variations config, `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtr_PrevSlot`



Bug: 40064499

entry.title: [ios] Implement observers for unified BookmarkModel instance
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



This is a follow-up to https://crrev.com/c/5340450 that properly

implements observers.



The requirement is that, when LegacyBookmarkModel is representing a

subset of a larger (shared) BookmarkModel instance, only a subset of

events should be exposed to LegacyBookmarkModel observers.



Moves are particularly trickly, as they may need to be reported as a

sequence of deletion and addition, if the move crosses the view's

boundary (i.e. move from local to account or the opposite).



Bug: 326185948

entry.title: Disable plus addresses from 403 responses to Reserve/Create.
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes:

- It moves (PlusAddressService-internal) error/success handling for

Reserve calls from the PlusAddressJitAllocator to a wrapper in the

PlusAddressService. This allows treating Create and Reserve in the

same way. It also eliminates the dependency from the allocator to

the service.

- It extends the treatment of 403 responses that List has to

Reserve/Create calls: A repeated 403 (now to any end point) without

a successful call before, will disable the PlusAddressService for

the session.

- It modifies the tests of the HTTP response code treatment - they

now all test the behavior using (fake) network responses.



Bug: b/318357301

Change-Id: Idd0e5c2c13eb98cab2313b69ff1d3784b35e6a8e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350126

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Kirubel Aklilu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270191}

entry.title: Prefetch: Handle prefetch failure during origin probe
entry.content:
We start running an origin probe after the prefetch has started

received a response and is considered servable. But the prefetch can

still fail before the probe finishes (OnComplete can be called with

a net error). If the origin probe finishes after the prefetch request

completes, we don't want to overwrite any existing failure status to

avoid a CHECK triggering.



Bug: 327289525

Change-Id: I9a8a98ab0e642cdc3c5f394662efa42fbdc17a73

entry.title: [anchor] Add CSSFlipRevertValue
entry.content:
This value behaves like CSSRevertLayerValue, except it reverts to the

value of a different property, given by the property parameter,

instead of reverting to a value for the same property like

revert-layer does. This "cross-property" revert-layer behavior

is useful for implementing "try tactics" [1] from

CSS Anchor Positioning.



CSSFlipRevertValue is entirely for internal use. There is no web-facing

change.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-anchor-position-1/#typedef-position-try-options-try-tactic



Bug: 40279608

Change-Id: Ibd037448eb88d571501ccb125d11b09e45f64941

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349521

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

entry.title: Get rid of float rounding when shrinking pages for printing.
entry.content:
When printing to an actual printer, a specified @page size may still be

honored by layout, but the result, if the honored page size is larger

than the paper, needs to be scaled down. There was some float rounding /

truncation involved, but this doesn't seem like a good idea in the first

place, except that one PrintRenderFrameHelperPreviewTest depended on it.

Adjust expectations instead. Expectations will still be integers, so

round all actual page layout values to the nearest integer (rather than

allowing expectations with a lot of decimals).



The motivation for this change is that I'm planning on letting Blink

take responsibility for laying out and painting the entire page box

(including the margins). This means that the shrink scaling code also

needs to be moved into Blink. However, whereas PrintRenderFrameHelper

performs the scaling on CSS pt values, Blink only knows about CSS px

values. As such, it will be impossible to truncate and round exactly as

before. So let's not do it, then.



Bug: 40281525, 40341678

Change-Id: Icfb9d4297af42e47707a68cb5888576b5a2c6e3c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349129

entry.title: Enables feature flag AllowWgcWindowZeroHz by default
entry.content:
This change is done as part of adding support for 0Hz screensharing

on all platforms and for all sources.



The WGC capturer has already been launched at 100% and this flag

ensures that the capturer path also supports detection of static

content which will save resources and allow us to trade this head-

room into increasing the frame rate in clients like e.g. Meet.



The added 0Hz-detection comes with a small extra cost in CPU load

but local measurements have not shown any power regressions.



Going forward; the idea is to gradually use this new feature in e.g.

Meet to allow it to capture windows on Windows at a higher rate

with a low extra cost; especially in scenarios where there is a mix

of dynamic and static content.



The flag can still be used as kill-switch if the Meet experiment

would show any signs of regressions.



Bug: 40259177

entry.title: [mullet] No manual fallback in incognito mode when no address exists
entry.content:
Address manual fallback should be shown even when users have no address

stored. We are going to prompt users to create an address if they

click on the manual fallback option.



However, it is not possible to store addresses in incognito mode.

This CL makes sure that the manual fallback option for addresses is always shown, unless the user is in incognito mode

(this is M3 flag gated).



Note that we do not have the same behaviour for payments. If an user

does not have a credit card stored, we never show the fallback option

for it.



Demo: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTY1MjQwMTcyOTA0NDQ4MHw4ZTg2ZGMzNC1lZQ



Bug: 1493361

entry.title: [Office] Fallback dialog for Android OneDrive unsupported location
entry.content:
Define OfficeTaskResult enum values for fallback dialogs that are

shown after a file open was attempted

(i.e. after `CloudOpenTask::OpenOrMoveFiles`).



When attempting to open a file from an unsupported virtual folder in

Android OneDrive (Recents, Albums, Shared...):

- Show error (fallback) dialog

- Record OfficeOneDriveOpenErrors::kAndroidOneDriveUnsupportedLocation

- Record relevant "open-attempt fallback" OfficeTaskResult

go/strpic/eaa65ae560950aa1d00da7e006641fa1dfab4f9f

entry.title: Add tests for invalidating all iterators
entry.content:
Add new test for the GSOC 2024 - iterator checker:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_kNdfe48YZhZol6cfN2sguSE7CqpVUwF_3VRXiKB2xo/edit#bookmark=id.ifdb6avhmtxx



Some functions invalidate all iterators of a container. But thus far, tests only have a single iterator associated with each container, meaning that the tests are not testing the cases when all iterators are supposed to be invalidated. This test checks that IteratorChecker handles this behavior correctly. This test uses std::vector::clear as the function that invalidates all iterators.

entry.title: Skip long-running tests by default
entry.content:
Tests in components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/internal may

take a significant time to run and should be launched with

--test-launcher-timeout 100000 on debug builds.



To ensure that they don't get accidentally executed and cause timeouts,

this CL guards them with a enw flag `--run-internal-tests`.



So the correct way to run them is via

./component_unittests \

--gtest_filter='AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/*' \

--run-internal-tests --test-launcher-timeout 100000



If `--run-internal-tests` is missing the tests are just skipped. If it

is present but `--test-launcher-timeout 100000` is missing the tests

fail with an assertion error.



Bug: 40279279

Change-Id: I6b45531a3581c74dcb3857c98a2cd7a562504fb3

For each tab, Chrome creates a new autofill client. Using the client

entry.title: Introduce better test names for HeuristicClassificationTests
entry.content:
We used to have tests named

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/0

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/1

...



It was unclear which test referred to which file.



With this change, the input files determine the test name.



If we have files

components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/foo.json

components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/internal/bar.json

they get translated into tests

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/foo

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/bar



That makes it easier to execute the test you are actually interested

and/or know which input data actually failed.



Bug: 40279279

Change-Id: I49e35385f15061ce56156c49ede26959757f4e4c

entry.title: [ios] Change "swift" tool to only list files in outputs
entry.content:
The outputs of a tool should not list directories. One reason is

that `ninja` will check the timestamp of the outputs to consider

if they have to be rebuild, but directories timestamp is rarely

updated (i.e. modifying files in the directory does not change

the timestamp, ...).



Additionally, running `gn check ...` in debug fails with check

failure in gn caused by the presence of that directory.



Instead, change the `swiftc.py` script to create a stamp file

(a simple file that is always deleted and recreated, ensuring

it always has a new timestamp) and list that file in the outputs.



Bug: 327928851, crbug.com/gn/362

entry.title: Update PlusAddressTable schema for sync support
entry.content:
This CL modifies PlusAddressTable in two ways:

- Since it was decided to sync down the profile_id and use it as the

storage key in sync, this should now be used as the primary key in the

database. To do so, the CL

- Adds migrating logic dropping the existing table and recreates it

with a new profile_id primary key column.

- Adds a profile_id to PlusProfile and adjusts the CRUD operations

accordingly.

- Adds migration logic adding a plus_address_sync_model_type_state and

a plus_address_sync_entity_metadata table. These will be necessary to

implement the syncer::SyncMetadataStore interface and use

PlusAddressTable as the storage layer for sync.

entry.title: [//gpu] Fix bugs in Mac Dawn SI rep's Begin/EndAccess()
entry.content:
This CL fixes two bugs in the Dawn SI rep's Begin/EndAccess():



* When returning a cached texture from BeginAccess(), we weren't setting

`texture_` to the result. This meant that EndAccess() short-circuited

out when called on a ScopedAccess for which the texture had been

cached at the beginning of the access.

* When returning early in EndAccess() due to there still being an

ongoing access to the WGPU texture, we weren't setting `texture_` to

nullptr. This meant that a second EndAccess() on the same

representation would incorrectly *not* short-circuit out at the

beginning and instead again decrement the number of ongoing accesses

to the texture. This could lead it to incorrectly conclude that there

were no ongoing accesses to the texture and invoke

SharedTextureMemory::EndAccess(). Notably, the Dawn representation

calls EndAccess() on its destruction, relying on EndAccess() being

idempotent.



The second bug manifested itself as a compositor problem when enabling

SupportsMultipleConcurrentReadAccesses() for this representation:



* An ImageContextImpl creates a Dawn representation and scoped access.

* A second ImageContextImpl creates a Dawn representation and scoped

access on the same backing, resulting in the cached wgpu::Texture

being reused.

* Submit is done for work referencing the first ImageContextImpl,

and it is subsequently released and destroys its scoped access and

representation. This results in SharedTextureMemory::EndAccess()

being called on the texture.

* Submit is done for work referencing the second ImageContextImpl.

Dawn validation fails because the wgpu::Texture is no longer

holding an access.



Existing IOSurfaceImageBacking unittests of caching didn't surface

this issue due to the first bug masking the second bug. This CL

fixes both bugs and additionally adds a unittest that fails unless

both bugs are fixed (of note, the existing unittests also surface

the second bug once the first bug is fixed). The unittest aims to

mimic the compositor flow described above.



Bug: 41496467

Change-Id: I1689d5f96634b0a1dd9bbece436eb9943da3dc93

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5352966

Reviewed-by: Austin Eng

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

entry.title: Remove kMaybe* values from WebExposedIsolationLevel
entry.content:
The WebExposedIsolationLevel is set in SiteInfo with potential values

KNonIsolated, kMaybeIsolated and kMaybeIsolatedApplication. The

latter two are always converted to kIsolated and kIsolatedApplication when

passed to the content/ embedder. It does not make sense to keep the

kMaybe* values as there is no place in the code that differentiates

between kMaybeIsolated and kIsolated or kMaybeIsolatedApplication and

kIsolatedApplication.
